channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The unique challenges of hosting this year's COP30 in Brazil
item.description: As COP30 U.N. climate talks start in Brazil, the host country president warns of "extremist forces" spreading climate lies as he calls for a global roadmap to end deforestation and fossil fuels.
item.content:encoded: As COP30 U.N. climate talks start in Brazil, the host country president warns of "extremist forces" spreading climate lies as he calls for a global roadmap to end deforestation and fossil fuels.
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: Bird flu safety measures leave 4H kids in California without real chickens
item.description: In California, the state veterinarian banned chicken shows to limit the spread of bird flu. That left county fairs across the state devoid of chickens — and their 7-year-old 4H caretakers despondent.
item.content:encoded: In California, the state veterinarian banned chicken shows to limit the spread of bird flu. That left county fairs across the state devoid of chickens — and their 7-year-old 4H caretakers despondent.
item.dc:creator: April Dembosky

item.title: President Trump has threatened to sue the BBC
item.description: President Trump has the BBC in his sights because it aired a documentary with an edited version of his speech to supporters on Jan. 6 before the Capitol riot. Two leaders of the BBC have resigned.
item.content:encoded: President Trump has the BBC in his sights because it aired a documentary with an edited version of his speech to supporters on Jan. 6 before the Capitol riot. Two leaders of the BBC have resigned.
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: What's next for both parties as vote to end shutdown draws near?
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Republican strategist Mike Ricci about the deal to end the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang talks with Republican strategist Mike Ricci about the deal to end the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey Pierre

item.title: Prominent Afrikaners refuse to be 'pawns,' and hit back at Trump's claims about South Africa
item.description: Prominent Afrikaners are pushing back after President Trump announced no U.S. officials will attend the G20 in Johannesburg, rejecting his claims of "white persecution" in South Africa as false.
item.content:encoded:
Prominent Afrikaners are pushing back after President Trump announced no U.S. officials will attend the G20 in Johannesburg, rejecting his claims of "white persecution" in South Africa as false.

(Image credit: Per-Anders Pettersson)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: Inside the unofficial movement to save the em dash — from A.I.
item.description: The extra-long hyphen known as the em dash is common in AI-generated text. While some writers have responded by choosing to avoid the punctuation mark, others are fighting back.
item.content:encoded: The extra-long hyphen known as the em dash is common in AI-generated text. While some writers have responded by choosing to avoid the punctuation mark, others are fighting back.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: FDA reverses decades of guidance on hormone therapy for menopause
item.description: NPR's Juana Summers talks to FDA Commissioner Martin Makary about the administration's decision to remove the black box warning label on hormone replacement therapy.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Juana Summers talks to FDA Commissioner Martin Makary about the administration's decision to remove the black box warning label on hormone replacement therapy.
item.dc:creator: Erika Ryan

item.title: Trump grants pardons to Giuliani and other allies linked to 2020 election efforts
item.description: President Trump issued a long list of mostly symbolic pardons for political allies accused of trying to overturn the 2020 presidential election.
item.content:encoded: President Trump issued a long list of mostly symbolic pardons for political allies accused of trying to overturn the 2020 presidential election.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Breaking Rust is a hot new country act on the Billboard charts. It's powered by AI
item.description: The AI-driven country music act Breaking Rust is climbing the charts. But will hardcore fans accept AI?
item.content:encoded: The AI-driven country music act Breaking Rust is climbing the charts. But will hardcore fans accept AI?
item.dc:creator: Henry Larson

item.title: A gambling scandal shakes Major League Baseball and two pitchers are indicted
item.description: Two Cleveland Guardian players were accused of intentionally rigging some of their pitches as part of a gambling scheme. It's the latest betting scandal in sports -- and it likely won't be the last.
item.content:encoded: Two Cleveland Guardian players were accused of intentionally rigging some of their pitches as part of a gambling scheme. It's the latest betting scandal in sports -- and it likely won't be the last.
item.dc:creator: Rafael Nam
